007.synopsis: A merregon - a footsoldier from hell assigned to assist the Orthon ( a huge infernal bounty hunter). Outside of combat, the merregon is unspeaking and unreactive, uttering only slight groans and rattling sighes. Upon attempting to read the thoughts of one of its comrades, you realise it's little more than an empty vessel, without personality or thought.
007.how_to_trigger: Speak to the merregon after peacefully resolving SHA_Orthon_TrespassLair / goto -646; -6; -754teleport S_SHA_Merregon_007

001.synopsis: A merregon - a footsoldier from hell assigned to assist the Orthon ( a huge infernal bounty hunter). Outside of combat, the merregon is unspeaking and unreactive. Upon attempting to read its thoughts, you realise it's little more than an empty vessel, without personality or thought.
001.how_to_trigger: Speak to the merregons in the orthon's lair after peacefully resolving SHA_Orthon_TrespassLair.

000.synopsis: One of the merregon henchmen accompanying the orthon in his lair in the Shar Temple. This one acts as a trader and beastmaster for the Orthon's displacer beast. The player can trade, learn about the merregon's connection to the displacer via detect thoughts, and convince it to hand over the potions used to control the beast.
000.how_to_trigger: Speak to the merregon after peacefully resolving SHA_Orthon_TrespassLair

002.synopsis: A merregon - a footsoldier from hell assigned to assist the Orthon ( a huge infernal bounty hunter). Outside of combat, the merregon is unspeaking and unreactive. Upon attempting to read its thoughts, you realise it's little more than an empty vessel, without personality or thought.
002.how_to_trigger: Speak to the merregon after peacefully resolving SHA_Orthon_TrespassLairSteps:1. Use roll amazing in debug2. goto -676; -754 in Shar Temple3. enter the room nearby, walk towards the piles of dead bodies4. cinematic starts. Pick 1 -> 1 -> 1 -> 1 -> 1 -> 1 -> 25. wait for the troops to get into position6. use teleport S_SHA_Merregon_002 in debug

007_0.speaker: Narrator
007_0.text: *The merregon stares through you. It knows only to attend to its master.*

007_1.speaker: Merregon
007_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: The merregon leers at the player, gripping its weapon tight.NodeContext: NB - the text between asterisks does not have to be vocalised/pronounced exactly as written, but rather treated as a guideline. Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

007_2.speaker: Narrator
007_2.text: *A dead-eyed stare greets you. A hollow, unthinking minion.*

007_3.speaker: Merregon
007_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: The merregon continues to leer without speaking.NodeContext: NB - the text between asterisks does not have to be vocalised/pronounced exactly as written, but rather treated as a guideline. Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

006_0.speaker: Merregon
006_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Merregon cocks its head at the player.NodeContext: NB - the text between asterisks does not have to be vocalised/pronounced exactly as written, but rather treated as a guideline. Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

006_1.speaker: Narrator
006_1.text: *The merregon gapes at you. An empty vessel - able to fight, die, and obey.*

006_2.speaker: Narrator
006_2.text: *The merregon stares, missing even the faintest echo of personality.*

006_3.speaker: Merregon
006_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: The merregon gapes at the player, unspeakingNodeContext: NB - the text between asterisks does not have to be vocalised/pronounced exactly as written, but rather treated as a guideline. Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

001_0.context: NodeContext: NB - the text between asterisks does not have to be vocalised/pronounced exactly as written, but rather treated as a guideline. Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

001_10.speaker: Merregon
001_10.context: NodeContext: NB - the text between asterisks does not have to be vocalised/pronounced exactly as written, but rather treated as a guideline. Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

001_12.speaker: Merregon
001_12.context: NodeContext: NB - the text between asterisks does not have to be vocalised/pronounced exactly as written, but rather treated as a guideline. Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

001_5.speaker: Merregon
001_5.text: Aid Master. Fulfil the hunt. Nothing more. Nothing less.

001_1.speaker: Narrator
001_1.text: *You sense little else in the merregon's skull. No personality, no thoughts - just raw obedience.*

001_14.speaker: Narrator
001_14.text: *Your efforts reveal nothing. If the merregon is angry at your attempted intrusion, it doesn't show.*

001_6.speaker: Narrator
001_6.text: *The masked creature eyes you dispassionately. Its only thoughts are of killing and servitude.*

001_9.speaker: Narrator
001_9.text: *Another dead stare. If this thing ever had a personality, it's long gone.*

001_13.speaker: Merregon
001_13.context: NodeContext: NB - the text between asterisks does not have to be vocalised/pronounced exactly as written, but rather treated as a guideline. Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

000_0.speaker: Narrator
000_0.text: *This merregon seems faintly more alive than the others - beckoning you to look at its wares.*
000_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: The merregon beckons the player towards its waresInternalNodeContext: This greeting if you're speaking to the trader merregon for the first time after having read the mind of another merregon previously.

000_18.speaker: Hoarding Merregon
000_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: The merregon beckons the player towards its waresNodeContext: NB - the text between asterisks does not have to be vocalised/pronounced exactly as written, but rather treated as a guideline. Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

000_2.speaker: Player
000_2.text: I am to tend to your master's beast now. Give me the potions.

000_15.speaker: Hoarding Merregon
000_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: The merregon stares blankly for a beat, as if it isn't going to do anything. After a prolonged beat the Merregon finally transfers potions to the player.NodeContext: NB - the text between asterisks does not have to be vocalised/pronounced exactly as written, but rather treated as a guideline. Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

000_20.speaker: Narrator
000_20.text: *The desire is there, but it doesn't have any potions to give.*

000_23.speaker: Player
000_23.text: Show me what you have to trade.

000_1.speaker: Hoarding Merregon
000_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: The merregon gawks.NodeContext: NB - the text between asterisks does not have to be vocalised/pronounced exactly as written, but rather treated as a guideline. Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

000_10.speaker: Hoarding Merregon
000_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Merregon stares blankly.NodeContext: NB - the text between asterisks does not have to be vocalised/pronounced exactly as written, but rather treated as a guideline. Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

000_12.speaker: Hoarding Merregon
000_12.text: Fill master's coffers. Do all that he bids. No more, no less.
000_12.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the merregon's thoughts were read and it was told it is no longer in charge of charming the displacer.NodeContext: A droning, almost mindless refrain

000_4.speaker: Hoarding Merregon
000_4.text: Fill master's coffers. Tend to his beast. Feed it potions. Keep it charmed.
000_4.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the merregon wasn't told it was no longer in charge of the displacerNodeContext: A droning, almost mindless refrain

000_22.speaker: Narrator
000_22.text: *This merregon has been charming the displacer, for the orthon. It has potions to control the beast's behaviour.*

000_6.speaker: Narrator
000_6.text: *This merregon is charming the displacer, for its master. It has potions to control the beast's behaviour.*

000_7.speaker: Narrator
000_7.text: *This merregon is the one who applied potions to the spider carcass - to charm a beast for its master.*

000_3.speaker: Narrator
000_3.text: *It seems this merregon is using potions to charm a beast on behalf of its master.*

000_16.speaker: Narrator
000_16.text: *The merregon resists your efforts. Most would be angry at such an intrusion, but this creature has no reaction at all.*

000_24.speaker: Hoarding Merregon
000_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: The merregon beckons the player towards its waresNodeContext: NB - the text between asterisks does not have to be vocalised/pronounced exactly as written, but rather treated as a guideline. Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

003_0.speaker: Merregon

Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

003_1.speaker: Narrator
003_1.text: *The merregon has nothing to say - nothing to think. It's little more than a tool of battle.*

003_2.speaker: Merregon
003_2.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The merregon cranes its neck and stares blankly at the player,.InternalNodeContext: 
.NodeContext: NB - the text between asterisks does not have to be vocalised/pronounced exactly as written, but rather treated as a guideline. Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

003_3.speaker: Narrator
003_3.text: *The merregon stares. Its mind houses little more than base instinct and utter obedience.*

002_15.speaker: Player
002_15.text: Strong, silent type, are you? Half right, anyway.

002_0.speaker: Merregon
002_0.context: NodeContext: NB - the text between asterisks does not have to be vocalised/pronounced exactly as written, but rather treated as a guideline. Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

002_1.speaker: Merregon
002_1.text: Aid Master. Fulfil the hunt. Nothing more. Nothing less.

002_5.speaker: Narrator
002_5.text: *You sense little else in the merregon's skull. No personality, no thoughts - just raw obedience.*

002_12.speaker: Narrator
002_12.text: *The merregon's mind is sealed. It doesn't even react to your attempted intrusion.*

002_4.speaker: Merregon
002_4.context: NodeContext: NB - the text between asterisks does not have to be vocalised/pronounced exactly as written, but rather treated as a guideline. Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

002_6.speaker: Narrator
002_6.text: *Another blank stare. There is no personality, no free will. Only loyalty to a master.*

002_8.speaker: Narrator
002_8.text: *The merregon watches you. No doubt its mind is stripped back to the basest of instinct, like all the others.*

005_2.speaker: Narrator
005_2.text: *The merregon offers an empty look and nothing more.*

005_3.speaker: Narrator
005_3.text: *The blank-faced mask suits the hollow-minded creature behind it.*

004_0.speaker: Narrator
004_0.text: *The merregon observes you blankly. Another near-empty mind.*
